intro: Coelidium pageae, commonly known as the Appalachian trillium, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its three large, waxy leaves and a single, showy white flower with six petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist woodlands and has a shallow root system. It is noted for its slow growth and long lifespan, often living for several decades. Coelidium pageae plays an important role in forest ecosystems by providing food for various pollinators and small animals.
